abstract_text:
There are several studies on prevalence of individual infectious disease markers (mono-infection)
in donors but none on prevalence of coinfection. Co-infection is significant as it
leads to accelerated disease progression. We, therefore, evaluated the prevalence
of co-infection among blood donors.
